Ad Text:
Company Description


For more than 20 years, KordaMentha has supported businesses through some of their most complex matters and opportunities. Founder owned and led; we are an advisory firm that helps corporations, financiers, lawyers, private investors and government clients to grow, protect and recover value.

That’s what we do, but it’s how we do this that makes us who we are.

Proudly independent, strategically local, and with a bias for action to get things done, we focus on doing what is right by our clients, our people, and the wider community. Our track record shows that we help navigate the best path forward in challenging times, and do so across cities, regions and territories.

In the most stressful or demanding environments, we continue to drive change where it really counts.

Job Description


Our Performance Improvement team is growing rapidly and is looking for a motivated Associate Director. As an Associate Director you will partner with clients on a diverse range of engagements from strategic reviews through to delivery of operational and financial performance improvement solutions. Specifically, you will:

collaborate with our team and clients to develop and deliver impactful engagements across a range of industries 
analyse financial information, identify issues and prepare recommendations for our clients 
assist clients to evaluate and understand the performance and position of their business; and
proactively create and implement solutions that are as varied as the challenges our clients face. 

This role works alongside Partners, with constant connections with clients and across the firm. You will enjoy:

Genuine exposure to senior leaders – you will provide support to the senior team members and will be relied on as a meaningful contributor.
Market leading engagements – we are brought in for complex engagements when significant value is at risk, whether it is financial, reputational or otherwise. Our clients are often at the most difficult crossroad in their history, and this makes the work important, interesting, and educational.
Meaningful work – our engagements are highly commercial, with an emphasis on developing impactful solutions to improve the bottom line and operations. As a team, our bias is towards rapid decision making and is grounded in deep analysis and learnings from client interactions.  

Qualifications


As an ideal candidate for this role, you will have:

Tertiary qualifications combined with 6-8 years’ experience, including experience in professional services.
An intellectually and commercially curious mindset to understand how businesses operate from the inside.
Experience in diagnosing and solving complex commercial issues.
Demonstrating attention to and passion for detail.
Strong financial and operational skills.
Strong analysis, financial modelling and / or report development skills.
Exceptional interpersonal & communication skills to influence stakeholders to successful outcomes.
A willingness to travel interstate as required.

Additional Information


At KordaMentha, we offer far more than just a job—we offer an opportunity to grow your career, expand your professional network, and make a tangible impact. As an integral part of our team, you'll collaborate closely with senior leaders in a firm that thrives on innovation and high-performance culture.

At KordaMentha, we believe there is strength in difference. Our entrepreneurial spirit expands the possibilities for action. We approach situations, challenges, and opportunities with optimism, curiosity, and diversity of thought. We seek novel solutions to problems and encourage unconventional and innovative approaches. 

Our team's diverse skillsets, backgrounds and experiences fuel KordaMentha's different mindset. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply, recognising that talent and potential extend beyond traditional qualifications. Our selection process values diverse perspectives and considers each applicant's unique strengths and capabilities.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Power BI Specialist to join its growing Data & Analytics team. This is a hands-on, business-facing analytics role focused on turning complex customer and billing data into clear, actionable insights. You will partner closely with teams across Enterprise Data & Analytics (EDA), Customer Technology, and Retail Services to design and deliver intuitive dashboards that improve customer engagement, satisfaction, and service delivery.

Key Responsibilities

Build transform and maintain robust Power BI data semantic models, using DAX and Power Query, integrating data from the Azure Databricks in alignment with best Data Governance and coding practices
Design and deliver intuitive, self-service Power BI dashboards that surface insights that empower business stakeholders to make quicker and more accurate data driven decisions.
Incorporate modelling and reporting best practices for optimised and efficient user experience and maintaining platform performance.
Collaborate with stakeholders across IT, Asset Services and external vendors to understand and define reporting needs that support customer-focused strategies, operational goals and ensure adoption of reporting solutions.
Translate business requirements into innovative, efficient and scalable data solutions, and collaborate with stakeholders to drive adoption of reusable and reliable data assets.
Identify and present insights to business stakeholders to influence business decisions and improve water asset management.
Serve as a bridge between business teams and enterprise data engineering teams to ensure data products are reliable, fit-for-purpose, and well-governed.
Support dashboard development, reporting, and analytics in partnership with process owners and business SMEs.
Contribute to the ongoing evolution of the enterprise data strategy, ensuring solutions align with strategic goals and data governance standards.
Manage releases, deployments, and BAU support for analytics platforms, while providing advanced troubleshooting and Level 3 support.

Skills & Experience

Proven experience as a Power BI Specialist / Senior BI Developer in a customer-oriented environment.
Deep understanding of Azure data services, Power BI, and advanced modelling techniques.
Strong skills in DAX, Power Query, data modelling, and dashboard development.
Ability to translate complex business requirements into scalable, data-driven solutions.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills with a track record of working in business-facing roles.

Qualifications

Formal qualifications in IT, Data, or related fields are required.


Please apply with current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Krunal Patel on krunal.patel@davidsonwp.com, quoting reference JN -122025-42073. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

Company Description

Empower Australia’s Payments Future with Cuscal  

At Cuscal, your skills drive change and make a real impact. Whether you’re supporting our clients’ customers in our Fraud Operations Contact Centre or delivering innovative solutions in Product Delivery, your contribution helps shape the payments industry’s future.  

Join a team that values collaboration, innovation and excellence. With a focus on professional growth and flexibility, Cuscal is where you can thrive.  

Forward with Cuscal.  

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Analyst, Credit Risk to join our Financial Risk team on a 12-month maximum term contract, to support in the strategic reporting of Financial Risks.

The Senior Analyst, Credit Risk is responsible for: 

The management of Cuscal’s credit risk on a portfolio of counterparty exposures. This includes the preparation and process of applications from (potential) borrowers/counter parties for approval, by carrying out necessary credit, liquidity and other assessments in line with the documented procedures.  
To aid in the management of Cuscal’s credit and treasury risk in accordance with prudential standards and Board policy to minimise the potential for loss. 

You’ll also make an impact by: 

Management of credit risk on a selected portfolio of ADIs and Corporate exposures.  
Preparation and processing of detailed credit submissions for all committed and uncommitted facility applications and annual reviews on designated counterparties for approval by delegated authorities in accordance with Cuscal’s policies. 
Ongoing monitoring of counterparties' credit worthiness and their latest development via all available means such as periodic financial updates and covenant, limit excess or watch list reporting.  
Provision of timely credit decisions for all permanent and transactional credit requests as per delegated authorities. 
Where applicable, meet with new and prospective clients for credit risk related matters. 
Maintain complete and accurate counterparty records in all risk management system and database on the designated portfolio. 
Assist in the preparation of reports for submission to ALCO and the Board Risk Committee and any other committees as required. 
Assist the ongoing improvement to existing credit risk related policies and procedures and their implementation.  
Provide insights with the ongoing improvement to existing credit risk related policies and procedures and their implementation. 

 

What you’ll bring 

You’ve got the ability to think critically and to solve complex problems. You’ve got excellent communication and an eye for detail. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are keen to contribute to a dynamic team.

To succeed in this role, you’ll have: 

2+ years credit experience covering financial institutions and corporates
Sound understanding of credit analysis techniques and a good understanding of credit scoring models
Good general knowledge of the APRA prudential standards, particularly those applicable to ADIs 
Familiarity with lending practices and products 
Good understanding of ratings agencies
Familiarity with loan security documentation 
Sound ability to read and understand balance sheets, profit & loss, cash flow statements and other financial reports. 
Effective communication skills and strong stakeholder relationship management
Additional Information

Why Cuscal? 

At Cuscal, you’ll find a strong, successful company that’s reimagining the future. And our team is right there at the heart of it all.   

Here, you’ll deliver or support interesting, ground-breaking work that has real impact - on Australia’s financial services sector and the millions of customers it serves.  

You’ll innovate alongside skilled, smart, connected teams. 

And you’ll build an impressive, fulfilling career that continues to grow.   

You’ll also enjoy a range of benefits, including: 

Recognition and growth: Celebrate achievements through IGNITE and grow with tailored development opportunities. 
Wellbeing focus: Access initiatives supporting physical, mental, and financial health, plus discounts via ‘Cuscal Advantage.’ 
Diversity and inclusion: Join a workplace that values different perspectives and flexible work arrangements. 

Join us and reimagine the future 

Ready to make an impact? Click APPLY to join today. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we’d love to explore how you can contribute to our vision for the future. Screening and interviews may occur before the job ad closing date, so don’t wait - apply now. 

Cuscal is an equal opportunity employer committed to an equitable, diverse, and socially inclusive work environment and a positive, barrier-free recruitment process.  

We welcome applicants from an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, people living with a disability, LGBTQIA+ and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to explore career opportunities with Cuscal.   

Note: Cuscal does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or search firms.

Job Title: Data & Testing Lead - Donesafe Implementation / Digital Transformation
Ad Text:
Contract: 6 Months (High potential for extension)  

About Stowe Australia 

Stowe Australia is a leading family owned electrical and communications contractor with a heritage dating back to 1910. As one of Australia's largest electrical contractors with a national footprint and a workforce of over 2,000 employees, the company delivers comprehensive solutions across major projects. Driven by a strong safety culture and a commitment to innovation, Stowe combines over a century of operational excellence with a steady and diverse client base throughout the country. 

The Opportunity 

Stowe Australia is embarking on a major national transformation of our Health, Safety, Environment, and Quality (HSEQ) systems. We are moving away from legacy processes to implement the HSI Donesafe platform across our entire national operation.  To support this program, we’re seeking an experienced Data Analysis & Testing Lead. 

This is a core assurance and is essential to the successful delivery of the program.  This role will own the data quality, extraction, cleansing, validation and end to end UAT making this role a key determinant of whether the platform is safe, accurate, and ready for national deployment.   

This is a hands-on, high-impact contract role where you will work directly with the project team, SMEs, and the vendor to ensure the platform is ready for a successful national rollout. 

The Role 

As the Data & Testing Lead, you will be responsible for: 

Leading data mapping, cleansing, transformation, migration and validation activities 
Developing and implementing end-to-end testing strategies, comprehensive test plans, detailed scripts, and UAT governance  
Coordinating and executing UAT across 25+ Donesafe modules 
Managing defects, retesting and go-live readiness 
Working closely with the HSI Donesafe vendor team and Stowe SMEs 
Supporting documentation, reporting and change readiness activities 
You will be the key technical and Quality Assurance specialist for this transformation program. 

About You 

You are a detail-oriented data specialist with strong testing experience and the confidence to lead a large-scale SaaS implementation. You bring: 

Essential 

5+ years in data analysis, data migration or data governance 
Strong experience leading UAT and functional testing for SaaS/enterprise systems 
Ability to create clear test plans, test cases, scripts and traceability 
Excellent Excel capability (Power Query, XLOOKUP, cleansing, validation) 
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills 
Ability to work independently and proactively in a fast-paced delivery environment 

Nice to Have 

Experience with HSI Donesafe, HSI Solv, or other HSE/WHS systems (INX, Bsafe etc) 
Background in construction, electrical, mining, field services or compliance industries 
Experience with integrations (API/SFTP), SQL or Power BI 

Why Join This Project? 

Impact: Play a key role in a high profile digital transformation for an industry leader and deliver a platform that will enhance safety and operational excellence across the business 
Influence: You aren’t just inheriting a system; you are helping design it from the ground up to ensure it works for our people.  
Longevity: While this is a 6-month contract, extension is highly likely as we move into national rollout and continuous improvement phases. 

Ready to shape the future of safety at Stowe? 

If you are an experienced Data and Testing professional and wants to apply your skills to a major transformation project, apply now.

A bit about us

At Judo, we're more than just a business bank – we're pioneers in redefining business banking for the modern era. Rooted in timeless values such as integrity, trusted relationships, and a challenger spirit, we're dedicated to revolutionising business banking for Small to Medium Enterprises (SMEs) across Australia. Our journey began in 2016 with a bold vision and a PowerPoint slide, driven by a desire to challenge the status quo in an industry dominated by the major players. In just a few short years, we've grown exponentially, establishing ourselves as one of the fastest-growing new banks globally, with 27 offices spanning the nation.

At the heart of our ethos lies a commitment to supporting Australian SMEs, placing our people and customers front and centre in everything we do. Our agility and adaptability enable us to say 'yes' when other banks say 'no', making it easier for our customers to secure the funding they need, precisely when they need it. We take immense pride in our personal approach to banking, fostering diverse relationships and cultivating a collaborative culture within our team.

Our culture – come and join a multi-award-winning place to work

We firmly believe that culture eats strategy for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and the most important investment we can make is in our people. Our Values of trust, teamwork, accountability and performance underpin the foundation of our culture.

We're not your average bank. Judo was built from the ground up, with one purpose: to be the most trusted SME business bank in Australia. We made sure to cultivate a space where bureaucracy is left at the door - where our customers come first with relationships at the core of what we do. We aspire to think differently, inviting new ideas, and creating a space where everyone feels like they belong because we know that it's our unique differences that make us collectively stronger.

We are thrilled to be externally recognised for our unique culture too! We were awarded the #1 ranking in LinkedIn’s Top Companies in Australia list as well as named in the AFR’s BOSS Best Places To Work list for 3 years in a row. We’re also super proud to be included in the 2024 HRD Australia 5-Star Employers of Choice list and officially be Great Place To Work Australia certified!

Our people and our culture are truly our secret sauce.




Now, about this role…

In this role, you will work closely with the credit models team to design, enhance, and monitor credit risk models that are critical to Judo’s risk quantification and decision-making frameworks. Your work will directly support regulatory capital, provisioning, and internal credit risk assessment, helping to ensure models are both analytically robust and aligned with the dynamics of SME lending. 

You’ll also contribute to the continual refinement of Judo’s quantitative modelling capabilities and play a key role in embedding advanced analytics into credit risk strategies and systems. Beyond model development, you will help optimise credit risk processes and ensure model outputs are effectively leveraged to support the bank’s broader strategic and commercial objectives. 

If that excited you, then this opportunity might just be your dream job:  

Engage with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure model outputs support strategic business objectives and regulatory commitments. 
Contribute to the optimisation of end-to-end modelling processes, improving efficiency, transparency, and integration into broader credit risk workflows. 
Perform deep-dive analysis of portfolio trends to support model assumptions, segmentation, and strategy development. 
Drive the development, monitoring, and refinement of credit risk models across regulatory capital, provisioning, and internal risk frameworks. 
Design and implement methodological improvements to strengthen model accuracy, interpretability, and compliance with regulatory expectations. 
Work collaboratively to align modelling activities with Judo’s credit risk appetite, ensuring models are fit-for-purpose and responsive to portfolio changes. 



A little bit about you…

Your life pre-Judo and the skills you’ve picked up along the way:

A degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Science, Data Science, or Quantitative Finance, with a focus on credit risk or model development. 
Proven experience in the end-to-end development of quantitative models, including data extraction, feature engineering, modelling, validation, and documentation. 
Strong working knowledge of statistical programming languages such as R and/or Python; familiarity with version control tools and reporting via Power BI is a plus. 
Prior exposure to credit risk modelling (PD, LGD, EAD), model monitoring, or validation in a banking or regulatory environment. 
Excellent communication and collaboration skills and the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 

At Judo, our culture sets us apart. 

Our Values: 

Accountability: Make decisions and own them. Do what you say. 
Performance: Strive to improve each day, surpassing yesterday's achievements. 
Teamwork: We're not just a team; we're a champion team. 
Trust: The cornerstone of our purpose and relationships. 

We're seeking individuals who embody resilience, positivity, curiosity, hunger for success, adaptability, passion, courage, decisiveness, and a hands-on approach. 

What our team members say about us: 

Our people are empowered to make decisions, take ownership, and contribute to a collaborative environment. Bureaucracy is non-existent as we focus on collective success. At Judo, diversity isn't just valued; it's celebrated. We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone thrives, making us collectively stronger. Our team works tirelessly towards our purpose while enjoying the journey of revolutionizing Australian SME business banking. 

Perks of joining us:

Additional 2 weeks of leave annually (that’s 6-weeks per year!)
Big life event leave
Home office setup allowance
Access to CU Health
Flexible work options, embracing a true hybrid model.

If this resonates with you, reach out - we'd love to hear from you.  

To learn more about how Judo manages your personal information during the recruitment process, please refer to our Privacy Statement. By providing your information, you consent to its collection, use, disclosure, and management as outlined therein.  

Please no agencies! We maintain a preferred panel, and kindly request no unsolicited contact. We do not hold any responsibility for dispute over candidate ownership if you have not been engaged directly.

Reporting / BI Analyst - Microsoft Dynamics 365 & Power Platform

Your new company

This organisation is undergoing a major transformation with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform. This role is critical to delivering improved visibility and real-time reporting across the enterprise.

Your new role

As a Reporting / BI Analyst, you will:

Design and develop reports, dashboards, and analytics using Power BI and D365 F&O embedded reporting capabilities to support financial, operational, and compliance requirements (GL, AP/AR, procurement, occupancy, care metrics).
Collaborate with SMEs to define the enterprise data model underpinning the new ERP/RMS environment, including D365 F&O data entities, RMS data structures, and curated data layers (Azure SQL / Data Lake).
Build and maintain standardised reporting datasets and semantic models enabling self-service reporting while ensuring a single source of truth across finance, operations, and clinical governance.
Support testing and validation of reporting outputs, ensuring traceability to requirements, correct data lineage, and alignment with financial controls and audit standards.
Assist in assembling management reporting packs and dashboards for leadership and Steering Committees (month-end performance, benefits tracking, risk and issue views) using Power BI and Office 365.
Contribute to the long-term BI and data governance model, including ownership, access control, and data quality rules for the D365/RMS landscape.

What you'll need to succeed

Strong experience with Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations, and Azure data services.
Proven ability to design enterprise data models and reporting solutions.
Knowledge of financial and operational reporting requirements.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills.

What you'll get in return

Opportunity to work on a high-impact transformation project.
Collaborative environment with cutting-edge Microsoft technologies.
Competitive salary and benefits.

What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'Apply Now' or contact Rajat Jha at Hays on (+61 8 9254 4532) or rajat.jha@hays.com.au for more information.


If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career.

What's the role?

Are you a social media and off-platform leader looking for a role with scale, influence, and real impact? This oneʼs for you.

Australians are spending more time than ever on a diversifying network of platforms, and increasingly turning to them for news. The challenge for publishers is clear: meet audiences where they are and deliver value in ways that strengthen the future of journalism.

This new role is critical to that mission. Partnering with the Head of Platform Content Strategy, youʼll be leading the delivery of News Corpʼs enterprise off-platform strategy, including social media, Apple News, AI, and emerging platforms.
Spanning implementation, measurement, governance, tools, experimentation, and capability building, youʼll also lead, coach, and support our many mastheads and brands to deliver exceptional outcomes off-platform.

In short, youʼll be one of the key drivers ensuring we maximise the value of our content off-platform, to help our journalism serve more Australians, more often.

What You'll Do

Initiative Leadership & Project Management
● Lead the end-to-end delivery of News Corp Australiaʼs off-platform strategy projects.
● Partner with the Head of Platform Content Strategy to manage the ongoing development and evolution of the off-platform strategy and roadmap, aligning initiatives with broader business objectives and audience growth goals.
● Guide and coach brands to implement the enterprise off-platform strategy through tailored playbooks and frameworks that drive excellence across channels.
● Lead enterprise insights and reporting, translating performance data into clear, actionable narratives that inform strategic direction and demonstrate impact.
● Manage strong partnerships with major platforms and vendors, ensuring News Corpʼs strategic priorities and commercial interests are consistently represented.

Consultation & Capability
● Design and lead consultation, workshops, learning initiatives, and forums that strengthen off-platform performance and capability.
● Build and nurture a connected community of practice across the business to drive collaboration, share emerging insights, and scale best practices.
● Partner with brands and mastheads on high-impact campaigns and editorial initiatives, providing strategic guidance on audience growth, engagement, and monetisation.
● Collaborate with cross-functional partners across News Corp to align efforts, share intelligence, and embed consistent off-platform excellence.

Emerging Platforms & Innovation
● Lead initiatives to evaluate, pilot, and scale emerging off-platform technologies, formats, and content opportunities.
● Partner with our teams to identify and test new pathways for audience growth and monetisation
● Identify and interpret shifts in algorithms, distribution models, and platform capabilities to inform strategic direction.
● Capture learnings from experimentation and translate them into frameworks, playbooks, and case studies that embed innovation across the organisation.

Who are you?

Youʼre a senior leader who moves confidently in a fast-changing landscape, learns quickly, and brings clarity to complexity. You can influence at all levels, collaborate with teams across a large organisation and guide outcomes on the platforms that matter.

● 8+ experience in social media, strategy, audience development, or related fields.
● Proven experience leading large-scale, cross-functional projects or programs within complex, multi-brand organisations.
● Demonstrated understanding of social, search, video, and aggregator ecosystems, including platform governance and monetisation models.
● Strong capability in stakeholder management, change leadership, and data-informed decision-making.
● Experience engaging with technology vendors and platform partners to drive business outcomes.
● Naturally analytical thinker who can interrogate data to distill insights, and recommend
● Tertiary qualification in media, communications, marketing, business, or a related discipline is desirable

News Benefits

News Benefits is our way of saying thank you to our people for their valued contribution to News, our audiences, clients and communities. Thanking them for the great things they do daily, for the greater good of Australia. Our benefits include:

Exclusively ours - Access to publications and products from across the News Corp family

Health & wellbeing - Advice, support and facilities for healthy minds and bodies (including an onsite gym at our Adelaide, Brisbane & Sydney offices) 

Time off - News offers a range of leave options to support your personal needs and moments that matter in life: Parental leave, Birthday leave, Volunteer leave, Career break and Compassionate leave.

Helping you grow - Development opportunities (including diversity and inclusion - focused education series) and recognition

Financial wellbeing - Support on making the most of your money

Perks & discounts - Exclusive offers across a range of products and services

Giving back - Make a difference to our communities.

Workplace Inclusion and facilities – Engage with your passions through various employee-resource groups and accessibility to multi-faith quiet rooms & parents’ rooms

Who are we?

We are proud to be Australia’s most impactful media group, we’re even prouder of what we stand for. Together, we inform, advocate and inspire all Australians, for a better Australia.

With over 150 brands across news, sport and lifestyle, News Corp Australia is trusted by over 18 million Australians a month to provide the information and inspiration they seek.

Renowned for world-class journalism and marketing services nationally and internationally, we offer a fast-paced environment that encourages individuals to take control of their future and challenge themselves in ever-changing fields.

What’s next?

Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion We know that diversity strengthens our teams and newsrooms as we seek to tell stories that represent the diverse communities of Australia that we serve. Our people make us unique and we all have a story. We encourage people of all ages, backgrounds, races, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, abilities and gender identities to apply. Inclusion is important to us and we want everyone at News to bring their whole-selves to work. If you require any accommodations or adjustments throughout the recruitment process, or would like to outline which pronouns you prefer, please feel free to let us know.

If you require any accommodations or adjustments throughout the recruitment process, please feel free to let us know. For more information regarding Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at NewsCorp Australia please visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers under the DEI section.

FinancialBusiness

Senior Business Analyst – Business Continuity Management Solution (BCMS) 

12-month fixed-term, full-time | Potential extension up to 24 months 
Location: Pitt Street, Sydney CBD (hybrid working available) 
Start: February 2025 

About the role 

Join Uniting at a critical moment in our journey to strengthen organisational resilience. 

We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst to lead the design and implementation of Uniting’s Business Continuity Management Solution (BCMS). This is a high-impact role responsible for taking the BCMS initiative from business case through to implementation, with the opportunity to support progressive rollout across the organisation over the next two years. 

Reporting to the Head of Risk & Assurance and working closely with the Business Resilience Manager and the BCMS project team, you will play a pivotal role in bridging business objectives, compliance requirements and end-user needs. Your work will directly support Uniting’s mission and ensure our people and services are prepared, responsive and resilient to disruptions. 

Key responsibilities 

As the Senior Business Analyst, you will: 

Lead the BCMS initiative end-to-end, from business case development through to implementation, including defining scope, objectives, benefits, risks and financial justifications to secure executive approval 
Conduct thorough current-state analysis of business continuity processes, data flows, and end-user workflows, identifying gaps and inefficiencies through stakeholder engagement, workshops and documentation review 
Design the target-state BCMS, including: 
Streamlined incident response and recovery processes 
Optimised data models and system integrations 
User-centred changes that drive adoption and usability 
Partner closely with the Business Resilience Manager and project stakeholders to elicit requirements, build consensus and maintain clear communication throughout delivery 
Develop user-centred design artefacts such as process maps, data flow diagrams and user journey maps to inform solution design 
Develop and manage project plans, timelines and risk mitigation strategies to ensure successful delivery 
Lead usability testing and user acceptance testing to validate solutions against business and user requirements 
Clearly document and communicate requirements, scope, progress and outcomes to stakeholders at all levels 

Key relationships 

You will form strong working relationships with: 

Project Delivery team (Project Manager, Digital & Partnerships Specialist, Portfolio & Vendor Management Lead, Solution Architecture) 
Business Resilience Manager 
Head of Risk & Assurance 
A wide range of business and operational stakeholders 

About you 

You are a seasoned Senior Business Analyst who thrives in complex environments and is comfortable leading through influence. You combine strong system implementation skills and analytical capabilities with a human-centred mindset, bringing structure, discipline, and clarity to ambiguity. 

You will bring: 

A Bachelor qualification in a relevant field or equivalent experience 
Typically 5+ years’ experience in business analysis, systems design and implementation, human-centred design and user experience 
Proven experience leading initiatives from business case through to implementation 
Exposure to designing and implementing business continuity management systems and/or working knowledge of business continuity and crisis management frameworks 
Demonstrated experience conducting current-state analysis and designing target-state processes, data models and user experiences 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including evaluating shortlisted systems against organisational needs 
Experience working collaboratively with designers, developers and governance teams 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the confidence to engage senior stakeholders 
The ability to manage multiple streams of work using Agile/Scrum and/or Waterfall methodologies 
A highly organised, thorough and detail-oriented approach 

Even better if you have 

SAFe Agile experience 
Familiarity with business continuity standards such as ISO 22301 or NIST SP 800-34 
Experience with tools such as Microsoft Visio, Lucidchart, SQL or Tableau for process modelling or data analysis 

How to apply:  Submit your CV and a brief cover letter highlighting why this role appeals to you. Should you have any questions, please email Louise Massie at mmassie@uniting.org 

 
Uniting NSW.ACT contributes to the work and mission of the Uniting Church in NSW and the ACT through social justice advocacy, community services and spiritual care. We provide care and support for people through all ages and stages of life, with a focus on people experiencing disadvantage and vulnerability. Our purpose is to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice. 

Uniting is a Child Safe Organisation committed to promoting the safety, wellbeing and inclusion of children and young people. 

Empowered by diversity 
At Uniting, inclusion isn’t just something we value – it’s how we work. Our culture and practice reflect the vibrant diversity of our colleagues, and the clients and communities we serve.

Company Description


It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Job Description


ServiceNow is actively seeking an exceptional Principal Strategist for our Inspire Value – Australia & NZ team. As a crucial pillar within ServiceNow Global Industry and Solutions Org, and a senior member of Inspire Value APAC, the team is committed to revolutionizing the enterprise software customer experience and deliver unparalleled value and exponential returns for customers.

Our approach is founded on a understanding of diverse industries, our customers strategic imperatives, and their desired outcomes. We engage extensively with our customers to discern how ServiceNow can effectively drive their digital transformation objectives through bespoke, industry-specific solutions, and strategic partnerships.

At the core of our approach is the proprietary Now Value methodology. The Principal Strategist will leverage this framework to design and lead strategic, consultative interactions that forge consensus and alignment, translating the technical capabilities of the NOW Platform into quantifiable, CXO-level business transformation outcomes.

Drawing from years of practical experience and a profound understanding of both business and technology trends, the Inspire Value Principal serves as an invaluable partner to our sales leadership, account teams, and customer executives, collaborating closely with these stakeholders to ensure mutual success and lasting impact.

This role combines strategic leadership with customer impact and team building in three core areas:

1. Strategic growth and executive influence

Partner with Sales Leaders to define and execute the regional strategic deals and growth strategy, acting as a key advisor to accelerate sales outcomes
Directly architect and lead the creation of compelling, board-level investment cases (including TCO, ROI, and risk analysis) for value-led transformations that routinely close multi-million-dollar strategic deals
Facilitate executive vision and value workshops with C-suite and Board-level, representing ServiceNow as a strategic thought partner for value-led strategic business transformations
Shape the future of our customers by identifying critical market trends and emerging needs that could lead to partnerships to accelerate our customers' growth and impact in their business

2. Be a trusted elite strategic advisor

Serve as the lead strategic advisor on must-win deals, personally crafting and delivering bespoke value propositions and business cases to C-level decision-makers
Act as a highly-skilled mentor and coach for our core Sales and Account teams, elevating their capabilities in strategic value-selling and financial analysis
Instil a culture of analytical rigour by leading internal coaching and enablement sessions focused on high-impact customer propositions and engagements
Drive adoption of best practices in strategic value-selling across the region, including detailed value analysis, benchmarking, and executive messaging

3. Organisational alignment and innovation

Foster a community of collaboration and knowledge sharing, working across internal functions to ensure consistent messaging and direction
Lead the creation of thought leadership, including industry points of view, best practices, white papers, and executive workshops, establishing NOW as the platform for business transformation
Act as a market and industry expert, providing data-driven feedback and expertise to Engineering, Product  and Solutions to drive continuous product and service improvement

Qualifications


We seek candidates who thrive on complex problem-solving and possess:

Experience from a top-tier consulting firm, demonstrating a strong foundation in strategic analysis, hypothesis-driven problem-solving, and executive communication.
A Proven track record personally leading high-stakes, cross-functional projects (internal or external), driving clarity out of ambiguity, solving complex problems, quantifying strategic impact, and influencing outcomes
Executive presence and gravitas to challenge, advise, and partner with both internal stakeholders and C-level executives and Boards of large organizations
An owner’s mentality to and proven ability to own, drive, and land complex deal strategies, demonstrating vision, bias-for-action, and accountability for customer success

To be successful in this high-visibility, executive role, you must possess the following:

Executive experience: 12+ years of progressive experience in strategy and management consulting, in-house strategy leader, or investment management
Strategic acumen: Exemplary analytical and financial experience with the ability to build compelling business and investment cases and quantify complex strategic value
Leadership and mentorship: Proven ability to inspire, motivate, and influence senior executives to outcomes, with hands-on expertise in coaching and solving challenging problems
Strategic consulting toolkit: Exceptional skills to build relationships and influencing outcomes at the highest levels, coupled with the integrity, empathy and passion for our mission and customer success
Adaptability: Ability to balance complex requirements, drive agreement across stakeholders, and quickly learn new solutions, functional, or industry domains
Technology fluency: Experience with enterprise cloud solutions (NOW platform experience is a significant advantage)
Industry expertise: Deep industry domain expertise in one or more industries, preferable in Financial Services, Telecommunications, Media and Technology, Natural Resources and Energy
Flexibility: Ability to travel up to 40-60% of the time across the Asia region

Additional Information


Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements. 

Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance. 

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

Job Title - Reporting Business Analyst
Location - North Sydney, hybrid working available
Monday - Friday, usual business hours

Primary Responsibilities

The Evolve Reporting Business Analyst plays a critical role in Ventia's Evolve Program, responsible for guiding the transition of reporting and analytics capabilities from the legacy SAP ECC6 and BW platforms to S/4HANA and associated modern platforms. Ventia's reporting landscape includes SAP, BW, Databricks, Power BI, and other tools, with thousands of reports-both sanctioned and unsanctioned-requiring rationalisation, governance, and alignment with future-state architecture.

This role requires deep expertise in enterprise reporting, strong business process knowledge, and proven experience managing complex transitions involving multiple platforms and stakeholder groups. The successful candidate will work across business and project teams to define reporting requirements, establish governance, and ensure a smooth and value-driven transition to S/4HANA.

Experience and Qualifications

Essential

6+ years' experience as a Reporting Business Analyst across SAP data platforms for financial operations, budgeting & planning, or accounting functions.
Proven success in managing reporting transitions in SAP S/4HANA, SAP ECC 6.0 for FICO module, Concur, or Ariba.
Strong knowledge of reporting and analytics platforms including SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP BDC SAP BW, Power BI, and other reporting platforms.
Experience in data governance, rationalisation, and stakeholder engagement.
Ability to navigate complex reporting landscapes and drive simplification.

Desirable

Experience with SAP BTP and embedded analytics.
Experience with SAP Group Reporting deployments leveraging SAP analytics cloud.
Familiarity with infrastructure, services, or asset-heavy sectors.
General Responsibilities
Evaluate & document as-is and to-be data mapping, identifying gaps and improvement opportunities.
Define and document current and future-state reporting requirements.
Ensure alignment with SAP best practices and fit-to-standard principles.
Engage closely with business stakeholders and platform owners (SAP, BW, Helix, Power BI). Ensure timely input into design, testing, and readiness artefacts.
Drive adoption of standardised reporting practices and governance.
Safeguard critical reporting operations during transition.
Lead rationalisation of existing reports and ensure alignment with business needs.
Promote clean core strategy by avoiding unnecessary customisations.
Collaborate with other workstream leads to manage shared resources and dependencies.
Support planning and execution of reporting cutover and go-live activities.
Ensure readiness across business units and alignment with support frameworks.
Key working relationships
Reporting & Analytics Manager (Direct Line)
SAP Program Manager
Databricks Lead & Developers
S/4 Senior Project Manager/s
HR/Payroll Senior Project Manager
Evolve Data Migration and Integration Manager
Ventia Reporting and Data Governance Teams
System Integrator Reporting Lead/Teams
SAP Architects and Solution Governance Manager
PMO, Functional, Testing, Change & Communications teams
Business SME's

Company Description

MedHealth are a purpose-built collection of industry leading health, medical and employment brands. Our unique and diverse capabilities come together to get the best possible health and employment outcomes for you and the people you support. We support whole populations to better outcomes, yet never lose sight of the individual we are working with to build a better life through work and health.

Job Description

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for transforming complex data into meaningful insights that drive strategic and operational decision-making. This role partners closely with the business leaders within the Disability & Aged Care Services division to understand challenges, identify opportunities, and provide insights-enabled recommendations. The Senior Data Analyst also plays a key role in enhancing divisional data quality, delivering visualisations/reporting, and streamlining reporting processes.  

Analyse complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for Disability & Aged Care Services Division.
Deliver insights and actionable recommendations that support business performance, productivity, outcomes and operational efficiency.
Develop and maintain dashboards, and reports for the division.
Automate and streamline reporting processes to improve efficiency and timeliness.
Ensure data visualisations follow best practice and communicate insights clearly to business users.
Partner with business leaders within the Disability and Aged Care Services Division to understand data needs and translate them to reporting/analytical requirements.
Conduct data profiling, validation, and data quality assurance tasks. Ensure datasets meet defined quality metrics for completeness, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness, maintaining data integrity throughout the analytics pipeline.
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytical roles.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and storytelling abilities.
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Strong SQL, and PowerBI skills.
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills.

Desirable – understanding of machine learning concepts, experience with Python or R for advanced analytics.

Additional Information
Promote and support practices that are inclusive, responsive, safe, accessible and sustainable
Maintain active knowledge of work health and safety practices and procedures, and take reasonable care of your safety and the safety of others
Adhere to all policies and procedures
Carry out other reasonable duties as required
Undertake project work as required by the business
Maintain strong internal controls to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

You are welcome here.

Our fast-growing team of more than 3,500 people around Australia represent a huge array of life experiences, skills and ways of thinking. We value all these differences. 

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, proudly welcoming people with disability including mental health conditions, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people from the LGBTQI community, veterans, carers and Indigenous Australians to our team.

We are happy to adjust our recruitment process to support accessibility needs.

We have the experience and capability to understand your specific requirements and match them to the right environment, ensuring professional satisfaction and development. We focus on fit — for both our clients and our candidates — and give you every opportunity to thrive.

The Opportunity
We are seeking two (2) Lead Data Scientists to support a Commonwealth research function delivering high-impact analysis across productivity and regional workforce assessment priorities. You will report to the relevant Director and work in a multidisciplinary team of economists, policy officers and analysts to deliver rigorous, decision-ready insights using large administrative datasets.
This is a 12-month engagement (37.5 hours per week), commencing 11 February 2026 (approx.), with an extension option of up to 12 months. Candidates can indicate interest in either stream (Productivity or Regional Workforce Assessment).

Key Responsibilities

Interrogate and analyse large administrative datasets using R/Python to support a research program.
Undertake sophisticated quantitative analysis, including labour market/economic research and modelling.
Produce high-quality analytical inputs, briefs, and report components to tight timeframes.
Communicate insights clearly and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders.
Build capability through coaching and constructive feedback within the team.
Manage milestones and priorities across concurrent pieces of work.
Essential Criteria (simplified)

Postgraduate qualifications in economics, econometrics, or data science (or equivalent).
Strong coding capability in R and/or Python, with experience using Australian Government administrative datasets (including PLIDA).
Demonstrated experience with advanced modelling (e.g., multilevel frameworks, Bayesian inference) and modern tooling (e.g., GitHub, Azure Databricks/Datalake, Posit) plus the ability to explain results to non-technical stakeholders.
Security Clearance

About the team 

The Portfolio Insights team at ARENA plays a vital role in bridging the gap between project outcomes and industry action, ensuring that the lessons and insights drive meaningful progress toward a net zero emissions future. Through a combination of strategic engagement, knowledge management, and impactful communication, we work to deliver maximum value to stakeholders across the energy transition landscape. 

How we achieve this: 

Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with key energy sector decision makers to facilitate knowledge exchange and drive collaborative solutions for the transition to net zero. 

Strategy development: Work with the Strategy team to set priority objectives for delivering portfolio insights  

Early engagement with projects: Collaborate with the Investment team and project proponents to develop robust knowledge sharing that maximise value for industry and stakeholders.   

Convening Stakeholders: Bring together stakeholders for events such as roundtables, insights forums, and workshops to share knowledge and foster collaboration across the energy sector.  

Commissioning Novel Analyses and Reports: Identify emerging knowledge gaps and commission targeted analyses and reports to address critical challenges in the energy transition.  

Navigating Policy and Regulation: Ensure internal stakeholders are informed about policy activities and insights relevant to ARENA’s Priority Areas, and engage with external stakeholders to address policy and regulatory barriers.  

Publishing High-Impact Reports: Work with the Corporate Affairs team to publish high-quality publications that share key findings, case studies, and actionable recommendations from ARENA-funded projects. 

 How we work: 

We take a portfolio approach to Portfolio Insights to ensure that we’re able to collect, analyse and share themes and trends in a way that ensures it is useful to stakeholders, both at the individual project level and the broader industry.  

Portfolios are based on either a technology, a funding round or a focus area that ARENA has or will invest in.  

About the position  

The Portfolio Insights Manager is responsible for generating high-impact portfolio-level insights that inform ARENA strategy development and investment decisions, as well as industry decision making. Sitting within an Impact Team comprised of one or more of ARENA’s strategic priorities and focus areas while connected to the broader Portfolio Insights functional network, this role translates project-level data into meaningful portfolio insights, designs and delivers knowledge products, and shares insights with stakeholders to influence actions aligned with ARENA’s mission. 

Key opportunities 

In this role, you will have the opportunity to: 

Develop strategic plans to deliver high-impact priority insights that can make a difference in the sector. 

Design and deliver knowledge products that inform industry and policy, influencing actions aligned with Australia’s renewable energy transition. 

Work within a cross-functional Impact Team and across the Portfolio Insights network to ensure coherence and shared learning 

Advise on Knowledge Sharing Plans, ensuring funded projects contribute to sector-wide learning. 

Build strong relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders to amplify ARENA’s impact. 

Grow your knowledge and position yourself as a trusted advisor within ARENA and the broader industry. 

What we are looking for 

Knowledge and experience 

​​Knowledge and experience in the renewable energy sector is essential​l. Specific experience in Hydrogen and/or Solar areas is desirable.  

Demonstrated expertise in generating insights from complex data, research, or project outcomes. 

Proven ability to lead complex projects or programs related to knowledge sharing, portfolio insights, or renewable energy innovation. 

Skills and capabilities 

​​Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills, with experience collaborating across teams and influencing external stakeholders.  

​Demonstrated resilience, proactive problem-solving, and capacity to deliver under pressure.​ 

Why us  

At ARENA, we are committed to providing an inclusive culture so our employees can bring their whole selves to work and have a sense of belonging. You don’t need to be an expert in renewable energy or energy markets, but a keen interest in advancing an ambitious energy and climate agenda will be helpful.   

 In addition to the above:    

We have flexible working arrangements  

You will have front row tickets to leading edge technology in the sector  

Work in an impactful and evolving environment  

Be part of a team that collaborates and makes a difference  

Invest in your career and your future 

We encourage applications from diverse backgrounds and experiences. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our workers and better outcomes for Australia.  

Applications will be reviewed in mid-January 2026.

We are seeking an experienced Interim People Systems & Analytics Manager to provide strategic cover to ensure business continuity and maintain momentum across critical people analytics initiatives following a recent departure. The successful candidate will step into a highly visible role, working closely with senior stakeholders to stabilise, review, and advance key capabilities.
This is a hands-on, outcomes-focused engagement suited to a senior practitioner who can quickly assess current-state maturity, provide clear recommendations, and deliver tangible improvements within a defined timeframe.
  
  
This interim engagement will focus on three critical outcomes:

Operational Excellence

Lead a review of the people analytics operating model
Assess how requirements are prioritised and delivered for the business
Evaluate stakeholder engagement and service delivery effectiveness
Provide practical recommendations to improve responsiveness, clarity, and value delivery
  
Technical Reporting Review

Conduct a deep-dive review of the current reporting ecosystem built on Workday and Power BI
Assess data models, visualisation design, usability, presentation layers, and user experience
Identify opportunities to improve insight quality, adoption, and decision support
  
Strategic Roadmap Development

Review and refine the people analytics roadmap, with a focus on migrating sensitive HR data to Databricks
Provide recommendations on data architecture, governance, and security
  
  
About You
We are looking for a senior, credible people analytics professional with real-world delivery experience. Industry background is flexible, what matters most is your ability to quickly understand complex environments and deliver the three outcomes above.
  
Key experience and capabilities include:

Proven experience leading people analytics or HR analytics functions in complex organisations
Strong operational and stakeholder management capability, including working with senior leaders
Deep hands-on experience with Workday reporting and Power BI
Practical knowledge of modern data platforms, including Databricks
Strong understanding of data governance, security, and handling sensitive HR data
Ability to provide clear, pragmatic recommendations and execute at pace

If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you. Please apply directly or email Ben McCormack at ben@tandempartners.com.au to express your interest.

Please note our offices will be closed from 24 December 2025 to 2 January 2026. As we approach the holiday period, there may be delays in response times and the Talent Acquisition team will begin reviewing applications from 5 January 2026. Thank you for your patience.

Own the risk game.
Put your stamp on AI and data governance
Your expertise, your influence, your legacy

The opportunity to join our team

We’re looking for a first-line technology risk senior specialist to partner with our Data Automation & AI business unit and to ensure innovation moves swiftly and responsibly. If you thrive on solving complex problems, building trusted relationships, and turning ambiguity into clear, actionable controls, this role is for you.

As we scale data and AI across the enterprise, your mission is to embed practical, business-aligned risk and governance, from data lifecycle and privacy to AI transparency and control testing, so teams can deliver responsibly and confidently. You’ll work closely with senior leadership, understand their priorities, and help them navigate incidents, issues, and controls with clarity and confidence.

This is your chance to shape how we build and scale responsible AI and data practices, collaborate with experts in privacy, governance, and control testing, and make a big impact in a fast-moving environment. You’ll join an enthusiastic, supportive team with a strong culture, enjoy autonomy to shape the role and make it your own, and work across the entire enterprise for huge exposure and influence. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to mentor, influence frameworks, and leave your mark.

Key Responsibilities:

Advise on data risk and technology governance controls aligned to frameworks and regulations (APRA CPS 230/234, CPG 235)
Implement risk uplift programs and embed data governance practices across Technology
Assess and monitor risks for data-driven and AI-enabled initiatives; manage incidents and issues
Establish and advise on AI governance frameworks, transparency, and emerging regulations
Develop key risk indicators and metrics for AI and data risks
Mentor junior team members and collaborate with privacy, technology governance, and control testing teams

What you will bring

Proven risk/compliance experience in 1st line technology risk (financial services preferred)
Strong knowledge of APRA requirements and data governance frameworks
Experience with data lifecycle management, retention, and quality controls
Ability to analyse complex data/AI risk scenarios and provide actionable recommendations
Exceptional stakeholder engagement and communication skills, including board-level reporting
Interest in AI, automation, and bots; ability to work autonomously and in a team

Find the better way

What gets us excited about working here? Helping people feel good about their money as one of Australia’s leading financial wellbeing organisations. From those starting out to those retiring. As your team, we’ll show up for you and together we will create financial wellbeing for every Australian. Because we know people who are confident about their financial future live better lives.

If this sounds like your kind of career, you sound like our kind of person. With us, you’ll do work that builds your technical know-how and challenges our entire industry to move forward. Along the way, you’ll be free to explore new ideas and technology, solve problems in a team, and independently to get great things done. Around here, we like to call it “putting our fingerprints on the future”.

People-inspired tech

Deep expertise combined with creativity can take on the trickiest of problems. Join our team of brilliant minds and mentors as we explore our way to innovation and apply technology in more human ways than ever.

To Apply

Read more here about why you should join our team.

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

We acknowledge and celebrate the richness that individual differences bring to our team. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process, please reach out and let us know.

Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
What you'll do

Lead the development of a HR data framework, strategy and roadmap that provides access to quality and curated data sets and supports the people analytics and reporting strategy in producing organisational workforce insights.
Lead the team responsible for the design, implementation, maintenance, and support of Azure Data factory and Azure Databricks, MS SQL based data warehouse including related data feeding processes as well as development of Oracle based Extract Transform Load (ETL) solutions. Analyse the organization's data related needs and develops a long-term strategy for the data warehouse. Establish policies and procedures related to data security and integrity and monitors and limits data access as needed.
Build the capability of the data function, data governance and support the provision of workforce business intelligence to the Department of Health and Hospital and Health Services to drive improved performance through access to timely workforce data through contemporary data management solutions.
Drive continuous improvement and lead the utilisation of technology and data management tools to ensure automated and replicable data outcomes through the development, analysis and formulation of sophisticated solutions to complex, organisation or system wide issues.
In consultation with key stakeholders, lead the transformation of existing reports and the development of new approaches in reporting, through contemporary visualisation tools that support accurate, timely and user-friendly data-driven workforce decisions.

About you

We are searching for someone with:

Demonstrated knowledge and commitment to industry best practice, including knowledge of contemporary approaches to strategic human resources concepts, practices, data management, data governance, information security and privacy, contemporary data services and metrics to achieve positive measurable business results.
Highly developed research, analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills including proven capacity to initiate appropriate strategic and operational responses to key issues relating to performance, trending and predictive projections to inform executive decision making and early intervention.
Demonstrated high level ability to analyse, prepare and present complex data driven recommendations, reports and submissions and to effectively communicate and negotiate outcomes at the highest level.
Demonstrated ability to lead, coach, inspire and drive a team of diverse employees.

Why work with us?

Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. This includes

Competitive salaries

12.75% superannuation
17.5% leave loading

Employee wellbeing

36.25 hour full time work week
Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave.

Professional development

Career progression with more than 300 diverse career pathways and career support to take you further!
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.
Grow your skills through hands-on experience and access to internal training opportunities and additional financial and leave benefits for approved external training and development.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion 

At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds.

Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions.
